conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the image to identify how liquid will flow from points A, B, C, and D through baffles and into containers E or F.
The image shows four inflow points labeled A, B, C, and D positioned above two containers, E and F, separated by baffles.
The baffles direct the flow, ensuring the liquid enters one specific container.

premise: Point A is aligned towards container F.
conclusion: Liquid from point A flows into container F.

premise: Point B continues the path initiated by point A.
conclusion: Liquid from point B flows into container F.

premise: Point C follows the path established by points A and B.
conclusion: Liquid from point C flows into container F.

premise: Point D changes direction due to the baffles.
conclusion: Liquid from point D flows into container E.
Liquid will flow into container E.
